title: Scala Serif alternative
content:
Can anyone recommend a free alternative for Scala Serif. For Scala Sans I am using Gill Sans (as someone on this board already recommended).

 [‹ "NOEL" classic looking capitals with sharp serifs](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122048/http:/typophile.com/node/35175 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Looking for Trendy (hand printed script reminiscent of Comic Sans) {Dennis Hill} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122048/http:/typophile.com/node/35207 "Go to next forum topic")
author: frankw

comments.content:
Gill Sans actually isn’t free. However, some weights of it ship with OSX. Which isn’t free.

For the serif: Check out the [FAQ Free](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122048/http:/typophile.com/node/14652). [Charis SIL](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122048/http:/scripts.sil.org/CharisSILfont) is _somewhat_ similar to Scala Serif—if you don’t take account of much more than the angled serifs. [Bitstream Vera](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122048/http:/www.bitstream.com/font_rendering/products/dev_fonts/vera.html) comes in matching Sans, Serif & Mono.

Then of course, Scala is rather unique— [and it starts from $40](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122048/http:/www.fontfont.com/shop/index.ep?clist=PS,12486&cview=P12486) …
